title: How broadband firms block you from getting the best deals
text:
Almost half of all households pay more than they need to have access to the internet, as complicated pricing and a lack of information leave many unaware that better offers are available.

Industry regulator Ofcom found that 8.8 million people – 41pc of customers – are overpaying by around £100 a year on average because they are letting expired contracts renew rather than seeking out a new deal.

Yet, industry insiders claim that often consumers are not aware they are paying a penalty for remaining loyal to their provider, as firms make it difficult to realise you’re being overcharged.

Martyn James, of consumer complaints service Resolver, said that he receives well over 500 complaints a year...
